PATH='/sbin:/bin'
# Read a single line from file $1 in the $DEVPATH directory. # Read a single line from file $1 in the $DEVPATH directory.
# The function must not return an error even if the file does not exist. # The function must not return an error even if the file does not exist.
sysread() { sysread() {
local file="$1" local file="$1"
[ -e "/sys$DEVPATH/$file" ] || return 0 [ -e "/sys$DEVPATH/$file" ] || return 0
local value local value
read value < "/sys$DEVPATH/$file" || return 0 read value < "/sys$DEVPATH/$file" || return 0
echo "$value" echo "$value"
} }
sysreadlink() { sysreadlink() {
local file="$1" local file="$1"
[ -e "/sys$DEVPATH/$file" ] || return 0 [ -e "/sys$DEVPATH/$file" ] || return 0
readlink -f /sys$DEVPATH/$file 2> /dev/null || true readlink -f /sys$DEVPATH/$file 2> /dev/null || true
} }
# Return true if a directory is writeable. # Return true if a directory is writeable.
writeable() { writeable() {
if ln -s test-link $1/.is-writeable 2> /dev/null; then if ln -s test-link $1/.is-writeable 2> /dev/null; then
rm -f $1/.is-writeable rm -f $1/.is-writeable
return 0 return 0
else else
return 1 return 1
fi fi
} }
# Create a lock file for the current rules file. # Create a lock file for the current rules file.
lock_rules_file() { lock_rules_file() {
RUNDIR=$(udevadm info --run) RUNDIR=$(udevadm info --run)
[ -e "$RUNDIR" ] || return 0 [ -e "$RUNDIR" ] || return 0
RULES_LOCK="$RUNDIR/.lock-${RULES_FILE##*/}" RULES_LOCK="$RUNDIR/.lock-${RULES_FILE##*/}"
retry=30 retry=30
while ! mkdir $RULES_LOCK 2> /dev/null; do while ! mkdir $RULES_LOCK 2> /dev/null; do
if [ $retry -eq 0 ]; then if [ $retry -eq 0 ]; then
echo "Cannot lock $RULES_FILE!" >&2 echo "Cannot lock $RULES_FILE!" >&2
exit 2 exit 2
fi fi
sleep 1 sleep 1
retry=$(($retry - 1)) retry=$(($retry - 1))
done done
} }
unlock_rules_file() { unlock_rules_file() {
[ "$RULES_LOCK" ] || return 0 [ "$RULES_LOCK" ] || return 0
rmdir $RULES_LOCK || true rmdir $RULES_LOCK || true
} }
# Choose the real rules file if it is writeable or a temporary file if not. # Choose the real rules file if it is writeable or a temporary file if not.
# Both files should be checked later when looking for existing rules. # Both files should be checked later when looking for existing rules.
choose_rules_file() { choose_rules_file() {
RUNDIR=$(udevadm info --run) RUNDIR=$(udevadm info --run)
local tmp_rules_file="$RUNDIR/tmp-rules--${RULES_FILE##*/}" local tmp_rules_file="$RUNDIR/tmp-rules--${RULES_FILE##*/}"
[ -e "$RULES_FILE" -o -e "$tmp_rules_file" ] || PRINT_HEADER=1 [ -e "$RULES_FILE" -o -e "$tmp_rules_file" ] || PRINT_HEADER=1
if writeable ${RULES_FILE%/*}; then if writeable ${RULES_FILE%/*}; then
RO_RULES_FILE='/dev/null' RO_RULES_FILE='/dev/null'
else else
RO_RULES_FILE=$RULES_FILE RO_RULES_FILE=$RULES_FILE
RULES_FILE=$tmp_rules_file RULES_FILE=$tmp_rules_file
fi fi
} }
# Return the name of the first free device. # Return the name of the first free device.
raw_find_next_available() { raw_find_next_available() {
local links="$1" local links="$1"
local basename=${links%%[ 0-9]*} local basename=${links%%[ 0-9]*}
local max=-1 local max=-1
for name in $links; do for name in $links; do
local num=${name#$basename} local num=${name#$basename}
[ "$num" ] || num=0 [ "$num" ] || num=0
[ $num -gt $max ] && max=$num [ $num -gt $max ] && max=$num
done done
local max=$(($max + 1)) local max=$(($max + 1))
# "name0" actually is just "name" # "name0" actually is just "name"
[ $max -eq 0 ] && return [ $max -eq 0 ] && return
echo "$max" echo "$max"
} }
# Find all rules matching a key (with action) and a pattern. # Find all rules matching a key (with action) and a pattern.
find_all_rules() { find_all_rules() {
local key="$1" local key="$1"
local linkre="$2" local linkre="$2"
local match="$3" local match="$3"
local search='.*[[:space:],]'"$key"'"('"$linkre"')".*' local search='.*[[:space:],]'"$key"'"('"$linkre"')".*'
echo $(sed -n -r -e 's/^#.*//' -e "${match}s/${search}/\1/p" \ echo $(sed -n -r -e 's/^#.*//' -e "${match}s/${search}/\1/p" \
$RO_RULES_FILE \ $RO_RULES_FILE \
$([ -e $RULES_FILE ] && echo $RULES_FILE) \ $([ -e $RULES_FILE ] && echo $RULES_FILE) \
2>/dev/null) 2>/dev/null)
} }
